result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 8:39 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James Allen Rhodes in court.
Court takes a recess.
Court recalls the case at 9:19 a.m.
Attorney Stephen Hughes appears as a friend of the Court.
Defendant does not qualify for a Public Defender.
Defendant wishes the Court to appoint Counsel for him.
Court will appoint counsel at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 8-1-2022.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendency of the case.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:32 PM Defendant James Allen Rhodes in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
